title: Episode 28 - "Glen Campbell"
synopsis: Glen Campbell never shows up.  I kept waiting and waiting.  And what's more, Moltar left.  So then there was no Glen Campbell and no Moltar either.(Synopsis by Hen Solo)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where are all the giant saucer crabs?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! "The Simpsons" are on! (pause) Er, which one's Homer again? The baby?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay, hmmm, let's see... page 7... (flips pages) okay, "The Joy of Escape". "It was Macciavelli that once said that escape is the primary joy of...", uh, blah blah blah blah blah... ah, here we go. "To win your freedom, you must only pull the inverse phase lever." Uh, okay. That must be this gizmo here, whatever that does. Down (pulls the lever) and da! All right! (laughs) what's it! Adios, Space Ghost! (evil laugh) (he walks away) Wait, where are my keys? Oh, I got 'em. (evil laugh again, fading as he walks off)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings citizens! My guest tonight will be cartoonist and creator of the popular "Simpsons" TV franchise empire, Matt Groening.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I know I said... I said "Groening"!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) You need to be more attentive.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Welcome to my show, Matt! Have you seen it? Do you love it?

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yes! I make it a habit of watching all shows that rhyme. "Space Ghost Coast to Coast", of course. "Dennis the Menace", "I Spy"...

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: "Tinkle and Dinkle the Ha Ha Twins".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There's no such show as "Tinkle and Dinkle", Matthew! (pause) Is there?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Love it or leave it, pal!

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: What, eh, what are you anyway?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm just a lineman for the county.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am, actually. (quietly) I am a lineman for the county.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ha! I'm a Space Ghost, you silly!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure, why not? Is there a law?

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: What are you a ghost of?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm the ghost of Christmas past! (pause) Now you say, "Spirit, remove me from this place!"

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: You remind me of Casper, the friendly ghost, sort of, except you're a space version, right? Who is Casper the ghost of, Casper the little dead boy?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You wonder if I'm a little dead boy.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: I think Casper was actually the ghost of Richie Rich. They look very similar.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in background, a la "Supertramp") You're bloody well right!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Soooo, have you ever been to outer space?

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Uh, other than this particular show that we're doing right now, no, I have never been in outer space.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Well, you know, in outer space, no one can hear you sneeze! (laughs hysterically)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, Matt, are you beginning to feel my superhuman influence? It should feel tingly.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Constantly, wherever I go. You know, I base my entire life on your teachings, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now you're talkin'! (pause) Aren't you? Aren't you talkin' now?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good question! Okay... (scoots chair closer) Did I mention I'm interviewing you from outer space?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good, because sometimes I repeat myself.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who? Me? (pause) It's... not really all that important. (trailing off) (pause) Tad Ghostal.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: That's just what a Fox network executive said to me, uh, the other day.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's a joke. (pause) Idn't it? (short laugh) Ever eat sushi?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (scoots chair away) (clears throat) Okay, how's about some advice to the would-be cartoon animators out there?

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Uhhh... watch the Cartoon Network, aspire, aim for the stars. Space Ghost, listen to Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sings to himself) "By the time I get to Phoenix, she'll be rising..."

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: ... I listen to Space Ghost, and look at me! I'm on the Space Ghost show!

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Y'know, really, it's a great show, I really like it. It's baffling, and yet confusing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Like a rhinestone cowboy, right? (scoots chair closer)

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: (in "Marge" voice) Grrrr, Bart, you naughty brat!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Make, make the one hit the other! Make him hit him.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, move the other one! No, no, pull him back! (laughs) Make him hit him! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: (in "Marge" voice) Oh, Bart, come on, I don't want... you never..." (puts the puppets down) What, what do you think?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't put them up! This is the only fun we've had so far in this stupid show!

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: I'm not very good at this, I've only been practicing for a few weeks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, Matt, cartoon "Simpsons", funny puppet "Simpsons", how long before the live action "Simpsons"?

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Quite soon, as you know, animation is incredibly expensive...

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: ... just, I mean, the amount of money you put into this show yourself, you know what I'm talkin' about!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (mouth doesn't move) Sure, I know what you mean.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Exactly, and so, uh, we will definitely be doing a live action "Simpsons". Uh, and as far as Homer, I don't know, do you have any suggestions, to who should play Homer?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Depends. Is Homer a superhero or an evil villain? Because I may know someone.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Actually, it's good that you mention that, because, uh, we were calling him for a while "Super Homer", uh, but your people had words with my people, and, uh, it's all being, uh, y'know, it's up for litigation right now, we'll see who wins, pal! (pause) Did I say "Super Homer"? I meant to say "Space Homer". I, uh, what the... you get it! Want to do that again?

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Well, now you're getting silly, Space Ghost! You know...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Okay, talk some more about cartoons.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Well, it wasn't what I always wanted to do. I was actually a philosophy major in college, but, uh, let me tell you, if you're a philosophy major in college, cartoonist is basically the only career open to you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I could have gone to college. But I didn't. And there's nothing wrong with that! Nothing!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat) Hey Matt... have you ever considered marketing the Simpsons' image on stuff? Y'know, t-shirts, coffee mugs...

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Oh, marketing the Simpsons' on t-shirts and mugs, sure we could do that, but it would be wrong.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wrong, like, how wrong? Wrong wrong?

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: I think "pandering" is one of the words that would come to mind.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, Matt, we have a few marketing ideas of our own, up this little spandex sleeve of mine.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Any day now, you should be seeing official Space Ghost footstools, resting beneath ever foot in the known universe (pounds desk) We're starting out with footstools, you know, take it slow, and we'll probably branch out from there. And sell some other... non... footstool related... items.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So, where do all those t-shirts come from?

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Those are all bootlegs, those things you see out there. We don't have anything to do with them.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh. "Bootleg". Is that anything like a footstool? Well, is it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do they sell? The, uh, bootlegs, that is.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: You have no idea what I'm talking about. You know, I think...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, put "bootlegs" on our list. Next to, uh, footstools.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! Zorak, what's he doing in...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. Well Matt, if Moltar was paying attention, he'd tell you that we're also marketing a line of exotic seasonings. Salt, pepper, ...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, do you like that? Zorak came up with that!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Anyways, we plan to package the spice rack with the footstool, and market it as the "Space Ghost Combo Pak". We spell the "pak" P-A-K. (teeth sparkle)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Citizen Groening, please issue some words of advice to the universe.

transcript.speaker: Matt Groening
transcript.dialogue: Buy "Space Ghost" cereal, but don't eat the prizes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "Space Ghost" cereal... Hmm! Now, would that have flakes in it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good idea, Matt! I'll see if the footstool people can make it happen.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We need to be on top of that flake deal.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We're going to be bigger that "The Lion King".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, did you get all that stuff about the cereal, that part about the flakes?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, are you listenin' to me? (pause) Where's Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Um, he left about ten minutes ago. He was always a quiet child...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Just pretty much kept to himself...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I told you already, he left!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos out, then invisos back) I'm checkin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to control room) Great Caesar's ghost! Moltar's... escaped! Oh, shoot!

transcript.speaker: Passenger 12
transcript.dialogue: (peeking up over seat behind Moltar) Pssst! Pssssst! Hey! How ya doin'?

transcript.speaker: Passenger 12
transcript.dialogue: What kinda hat is that? That's like the colors of the, uh, Buckeyes, ain't it?

transcript.speaker: Mr. Burns
transcript.dialogue: Good day. Smithers, release the hounds. (sound of dogs barking)
